text:
Vim script で `0b1011` みたいに2進数リテラルあるの知らなかった
そして vimlparser でそれをサポートしてないのに気づいてしまった… ("0" "b1011" にトークナイズされてしまう)
ので直した
<https://github.com/vim-jp/vim-vimlparser/pull/89>

attachments.fallback: GitHub: Support binary number literals (e.g. 0b0, 0b1011) by tyru · Pull Request #89 · vim-jp/vim-vimlparser
attachments.title: Support binary number literals (e.g. 0b0, 0b1011) by tyru · Pull Request #89 · vim-jp/vim-vimlparser
attachments.text: I found Vim script has binary number literals (e.g. 0b0, 0b1011), and they are not supported yet. Fixed tokenizer to support it. Sorry, I don't check from when the literal format is supported...

text: vimlparser も処理してない PR たまってるなぁ
